wikipedia_page.main: Gordon Brown (11 February 1885 – 12 January 1967) was an Australian politician who served as a Senator for Queensland from 1932 to 1965, representing the Australian Labor Party (ALP). He was President of the Senate from 1943 to 1951.

* Hon. Gordon Browna former President of the Australian SenateMy Descent from Soapbox to Senate. Co-operative Press, Brisbane, 1953
A state funeral was held at the church for Gordon Brown who was a Senator for Queensland from 1932 to 1965 (as a member of the Australia Labor Party); his ashes are kept in the church's columbarium.
Gordon Brown (born 1951) was Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 2007 to 2010.

Along with Gordon Brown, Collings was joint Father of the Senate from 1947 to 1950. Collings, at 85 years of age, remains the oldest person to have served in the Senate.

link_mentions.page: Candidates of the 1934 Australian federal election
response: Three seats were up for election. The United Australia Party was defending three seats. Labor Senators Gordon Brown, Joe Collings and John MacDonald were not up for re-election.
